name: Name of your experiment
description: Explains the what and the why. What is the main idea? What is the purpose? Describes the coding process and implementation choices and gives a high level system overview.

name: Schotter (Gravel) Recreation
description: A p5.js recreation of Georg Nees Schotter (1968), showing a grid of squares that progressively gain random shifts and rotations to illustrate the transition from order to disorder.

name: Walk-Through Raster (Recreation)
description: my version of Nake's raster, just a grid of | - and blanks with some randomness. kinda shows how order breaks into mess.

name: Walkers / Autonomous Agents
description: agents (dots) walk around using noise and leave trails. looks like the raster is moving instead of static.

name: Particle Flow Field
description: a bunch of particles with vel+acc moving in a noise field, makes swirly lines, more chaotic than walkers.

name: Walkers with Tone.js
description: same walkers but now with sound using tone.js. plays random notes from a scale with reverb when they move. starts on click.
